name: http://linksys.com/jnap/storage/UPnPMediaServer
desc: This service provides access to a device's UPnP media folders.

CreateUPnPMediaFolder.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/storage/CreateUPnPMediaFolder
CreateUPnPMediaFolder.desc: This action creates a new UPnP media folder on the device.

name.desc: The name of the UPnP media folder. This value must be unique. This value must be between 1 and 22 characters long and may only contain characters a-z, A-Z, 0-9, dash (-), and space ( ).

partitionName.desc: The name of the partition on which the UPnP media folder resides.

path.desc: The path to the directory that corresponds to the UPnP media folder. Relative paths are interpreted as relative to the root directory of the partition..

isReadOnly.desc: Whether the UPnP media folder is read-only.

groupsWithPermission.desc: The list of groups that have permission to access the UPnP media folder. This list must always include the value "admin".

errors.ErrorAdminGroupMustHavePermission: The specified list of groups with permission does not contain "admin".
errors.ErrorFolderExists: A UPnP media folder with the specified name already exists.
errors.ErrorPathDoesNotExist: The specified path does not exist.
errors.ErrorTooManyFolders: The UPnP media folder cannot be created because the maximum number of UPnP media folders has already been reached.
errors.ErrorUnknownGroup: One of the specified groups with permission does not exist.
errors.ErrorUnknownPartition: The specified partition does not correspond to any mounted partition.

DeleteUPnPMediaFolder.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/storage/DeleteUPnPMediaFolder
DeleteUPnPMediaFolder.desc: This action deletes a UPnP media folder on the device.

name.desc: The name of the UPnP media folder.

errors.ErrorUnknownFolder: The specified UPnP media folder does not exist.

EditUPnPMediaFolder.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/storage/EditUPnPMediaFolder
EditUPnPMediaFolder.desc: This action edits information about a UPnP media folder on the device.

name.desc: The name of the UPnP media folder.

partitionName.desc: The name of the partition on which the UPnP media folder resides.

path.desc: The path to the directory that corresponds to the UPnP media folder. Relative paths are interpreted as relative to the root directory of the partition.

isReadOnly.desc: Whether the UPnP media folder is read-only.

groupsWithPermission.desc: The list of groups that have permission to access the UPnP media folder. This list must always include the value "admin".

errors.ErrorAdminGroupMustHavePermission: The specified list of groups with permission does not contain "admin".
errors.ErrorPathDoesNotExist: The specified path does not exist.
errors.ErrorUnknownFolder: The specified UPnP media folder does not exist.
errors.ErrorUnknownGroup: One of the specified groups with permission does not exist.
errors.ErrorUnknownPartition: The specified partition does not correspond to any mounted partition.

GetUPnPMediaFolders.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/storage/GetUPnPMediaFolders
GetUPnPMediaFolders.desc: This action gets a list of the device's UPnP media folders. Folder names returned by this method are not guaranteed to be unique. This is to allow for detection of share name collisions due to external forces, such as a user inserting two USB drives configured with colliding share names.

upnpMediaFolders.desc: The list of UPnP media folders.

GetUPnPMediaServerSettings.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/storage/GetUPnPMediaServerSettings
GetUPnPMediaServerSettings.desc: This service provides access to a device's UPnP media folders. This action gets the device's UPnP media server settings.

isEnabled.desc: Whether the server is currently enabled.

autoScanIntervalMinutes.desc: The number of minutes that the server will wait after scanning for media files before automatically triggering another scan. If this value is 0, the server will not automatically scan for media files.

lastScanTime.desc: The last time that the server scanned for media files. If no scan has been performed, this value will not be present.

maxUPnPMediaFolders.desc: A platform-specific limit on the number of UPnP media folders. If this value is not present, there is no limit on the number of UPnP media folders.

SetUPnPMediaServerSettings.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/storage/SetUPnPMediaServerSettings
SetUPnPMediaServerSettings.desc: This action sets the device's UPnP media server settings.

serverName.desc: The server name. The server name must be between 1 and 15 characters long and can only contain characters a-z, A-Z, 0-9, dash (-), and space ( ).

isEnabled.desc: Whether the server should be enabled.

autoScanIntervalMinutes.desc: The number of minutes that the server should wait after scanning for media files before automatically triggering another scan. If this value is 0, the server will not automatically scan for media files. This value must be greater than or equal to 0.

errors.ErrorInvalidAutoScanIntervalMinutes: The specified automatic scan interval was less than 0.
errors.ErrorInvalidServerName: The specified server name name is not valid.

TriggerUPnPMediaFolderScan.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/storage/TriggerUPnPMediaFolderScan
TriggerUPnPMediaFolderScan.desc: This action triggers a scan of the UPnP media folders on the device.

name.desc: The name of the shared folder.

partitionName.desc: The name of the partition on which the shared folder resides.

path.desc: The path to the directory that corresponds to the shared folder. Relative paths are interpreted as relative to the root directory of the partition.

pathExists.desc: Whether the path exists on the partition.

isReadOnly.desc: Whether the shared folder is read-only.

groupsWithPermission.desc: The list of groups that have permission to access the shared folder.
